title: General
custom_preconds: Given At Bat is installed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to a team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Nav Bar and buttons should match the colors for the selected team

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to a team page on an Android 5.x+ device
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the device status bar should be set in an color shade offset from the team nav bar color

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user accesses the team page for a favorite team (from the slide out menu)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the team page should be a 'Top level' page 
And there should a 'hamburger' button
And the slide out menu should be accessible

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user accesses the team page from the teams list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the team page should be a 'Bottom level' page
And there should be a 'back' button
And the slide out menu should NOT be accessible

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user accesses the team page for a favorite team from the slide out menu
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then on the team page, there should be a drop down
And all the teams should be listed with the favorites appearing only at the top of the list according to the order set in app settings

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has a favorite team set
And the user starts the app fresh (force stop but not clear data)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team page for the top favorite team should be loaded and the user should be taken there as their default homescreen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user brings the team page to the foreground from the background
Or the user turns off the screen and turns it back on while on the team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team page should refresh immediately when it returns to view (scoreboard data only)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to any team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Audio/TV buttons should appear in the top right of the action bar

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls all the way to the bottom of the team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they should see a watermark below the last cell

title: Functional Behavior
custom_preconds:
Team data file:
http://content.mlb.com/search/atbat/en/android/phone/pit.json

Substitute environment, language, and team as necessary. 

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mobile/Team+Page+Controls+Enhancements+Android

Use the config values found in the data requirements to test: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mobile/Team+Page+Controls+Enhancements+Android#TeamPageControlsEnhancementsAndroid-DataRequirements

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify user can launch internal webview link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the web page should launch within At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify user can launch external webview link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the web page should launch on the device browser outside of At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify user can launch to app link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be taken to the installed app or the web store link

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify user can launch to specific market via link (i.e. Ballpark)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Verify the user can launch to the Google Play link on Android devices, user should not be able to launch the Amazon app store link since Ballpark is not available on Amazon store

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify 'Club Info' section is configurable for each team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then each item should appear with its associated icon
And if no thumbnail is set, the cell should still appear correctly.

title: Date Bar
custom_preconds: "Featured" game - The featured game is what the Team page's Game Detail section will open by default to.  This should be the current day's game (after 10 AM flip) or the next game for that team.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Team Page initially loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the "featured" game will be displayed on the second date of the 4 dates on the date bar
And the 5th block will contain the Team's full Schedule

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the current date is on or before the beginning of the season (or date range)
And the user opens the Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the "featured" game will be the first game of the season
And will be displayed in the first block of the date bar

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the current date is on or after the end of the season (or date range)
And the user opens the Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the "featured" game will be the last game of the season
And will be displayed as the fourth block of the date bar

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Schedule block on the date bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the Team's Schedule view (Calendar/List)

custom_steps_separated.content: When we swipe the Game Details section to the left/right
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the date bar will scroll to the left/right
And highlight the game displaying below in the Game Details section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the date bar
And the local, current time is before 10 AM
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the previous day's game will be located on the second date of the 4 dates on the date bar
And will be selected by default

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the date bar
And the local, current time is after 10 AM
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then today's (or the next game) will be located on the second date of the 4 dates on the date bar
And will be selected by default

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you look at the date bar
And there is no game scheduled for a date
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the date with no game scheduled will be skipped on the date bar

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And the team has an Away game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Away game will display the opponent as "@OAK" (for example)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And the team has an Home game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Home game will display the opponent as "OAK" (for example)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Scheduled game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Scheduled game will display the day, date, Opponent, and start time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a game in progress present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game in progress will display day, date, Opponent, and "LIVE"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a game in a Final state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the completed game in progress will display day, date, Opponent, and the final score

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Postponed game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Postponed game will display day, date, Opponent, and "PPD"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Suspended game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Suspended game will display day, date, Opponent, and "SUSP"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Suspended-Resumed game displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The Resumed Game will be displayed in the cell for the date that the game is being played on
And when the user navigates to that cell, the date for the game will remain as the date the Resumed Game is scheduled to be played on
And it will NOT be displayed on the date that the original Suspended Game was played on

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Doubleheader present
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then both games will get their own block
And the games will be in the correct order based on start time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Doubleheader present
And the first game has been completed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the second game will become the "featured" game

title: Game Details
custom_preconds: User is on the Team Page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Team Page has loaded
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a total of four games will be displayed at the top below the header

custom_steps_separated.content: When a particular day is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Main Game Detail section displays for that particular game

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game tapped from the Date Bar is in a Preview State
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Game Detail top section will display the Preview state correctly which includes the team logos, probable pitchers and team records

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Preview State
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the two teams win/loss record will display

Then the away team will be listed on the top followed by the home team on the bottom of the Game Detail section

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Preview State
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then tapping on the Preview button will take the user to the Gameday Preview for that game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the game is in a Preview State 
and there are tickets available for that game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then tapping on the Tickets button will open up the Tickets page for the Home Team

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Postponed state
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then PPD will display for the game

(check all postponed reasons)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Cancelled State
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the word Cancelled is displayed

(Check all reasons)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Delayed Start - Ceremony and/or Delayed - Ceremony
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the word "Ceremony" will display instead of Delayed Start and/or Delayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a live state and the game is in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a live linescore will display on the Game Detail section

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a live state and the game is in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we will see the active bases in the Game Detail section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When There is a live game and the user is on the teams page for a live game
and the user has refresh settings set in the Settings section
1) 15 seconds
2) 30 seconds
3) 1 Minute
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the teams page will refresh in accordance to the refresh rate set in settings
1) 15 seconds
2) 30 seconds
3) 1 Minute

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Challenge state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the word "Challenge" (Chal) will display in the Game Detail view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the game is in progress and it is in either a Delayed Start and/or and in-game Delayed State

(Use the Game States Page on the Wiki)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Game Detail section will display the word "Delayed" and/or "Delayed Start"

(as of now we are displaying the reasons)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Suspended state
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The Game Detail will display the word or abbreviation "susp"
And the Resume Date will be displayed below the game state

custom_steps_separated.content: When the app is backgrounded and user returns to team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then when you bring the app back to the foreground, the Team Page Linescore updates automatically

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on Gameday from the Team Page and observes the game for a few innings and then taps back on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: The Game Detail section should update immediately when pushing on the view

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Team Page and the Game Detail section is loading and taps on another part of the app (Team Picker, News) and then taps back on Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the 4/5 day Scoreboard and Game Detail will load with the current data

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game tapped from the Date Bar is in a final state
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Game Detail will display:
a Final state linescore
both home and away teams' W-L records
and Final pitching stats [W: <Pitcher> (W-L); L:<Pitcher> (W-L); S (if applicable):<Pitcher> (S)]

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in progress and/or a final state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the away team name will display above the home team name in the Game Detail section

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is in progress and/or Final state and has extra innings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we can swipe/scroll through innings in the linescore from left to right

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is completed early
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Completed Early displays as "F/5" for example
and there will be X's in the linescore inning columns of the innings that weren't played

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Forfeit state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the word Forfeit displays correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game tapped from the Date Bar is the date of a Split Squad game (Spring Training only)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then an SS logo will appear on Game Detail section during the game Preview for the team which is the the SS team (will display next to the team logo)
Note - There can be one SS team, or both teams can be SS - check logos for both teams

custom_steps_separated.content: When the MLB.TV and GDA (Gameday Audio) media is enabled for a particular game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Audio and MLB.TV links will be visible below the Preview/Linescore for the game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the team's current game is in an in progress and/or Final State
And we tap the Gameday link
And we tap the Box Score link
And we tap the Plays link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the appropriate sections will open successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: When you perform a swipe gesture from left to right or from right to left
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the date will change
And the game detail will change for that day

custom_steps_separated.content: When swiping through the specific Games
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Game Detail section display two team's matchup, game time and stadium name

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the "Audio" button in the Game Detail section for a Live game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Gameday Audio controller will display
And the Home Team Audio plays, unless the user's Favorite team is the away team

custom_steps_separated.content: When the device time is 10 AM on the following day
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Game Detail section will populate that days game info
And before 10AM the previous day will be displayed on the Game Detail section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the game details for that day that is two or more days in advance from the current date
Or has swiped to a date that is two or more days in advance from the current date
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not see the Win/Loss Record for either team

title: No-Hitter/Perfect Game indicator
custom_preconds:
UI/UX Rules: https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=55312418

Screen: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/ANDROID-4244

http://gd.qa.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/year_2015/month_07/day_27/scoreboard_android.xml
is_perfect_game="Y" is_no_hitter="N"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress after the 6th inning
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a Perfect Game
and the user is on the Team page of one of the teams participating in the Perfect Game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a Perfect Game indicator above the game cell to the right of the inning

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in a suspended state
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a Perfect Game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a Perfect Game indicator above the game cell to the right of the inning

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in extra innings
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a Perfect Game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a Perfect Game indicator above the game cell to the right of the inning

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is final
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a Perfect Game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator above the game cell to the right of "Final"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to the previous game in the Date Bar and no longer has today's Perfect Game selected (this assumes previous game is also not a Perfect Game)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator will no longer appear next to "Final"/current inning

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to the next (future) game in the Date Bar and no longer has the today's Perfect Game selected
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator will no longer appear next to "Final"/current inning

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to the other team page involved in the Perfect Game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator will persist above the game cell to the right of the inning

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to another team page that does not have an active Perfect Game on Today's date
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator will no longer appear next to "Final"/current inning

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress
and the flag on master_scoreboard changes from 
(is_perfect_game="Y" and is_no_hitter="N") to 
(is_perfect_game="N" and is_no_hitter="Y")
and the user is on the Team page of one of the team's participating in the Perfect Game

e.g. Pitcher loses perfect game but is now pitching a no-hitter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator changes to a No-Hitter indicator next to the inning when the Scoreboard refreshes

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress
and the flag on master_scoreboard changes from 
(is_perfect_game="Y" and is_no_hitter="N") to 
(is_perfect_game="N" and is_no_hitter="N")
and the user is on Team page

e.g. Pitcher loses perfect game and no-hitter simultaneously
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator is removed when the Team Scoreboard refreshes, user will not see the indicator downgraded to No-Hitter

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress
and the flag on master_scoreboard changes from 
(is_perfect_game="N" and is_no_hitter="Y") to 
(is_perfect_game="N" and is_no_hitter="N")

e.g. Pitcher loses no-hitter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the No-Hitter indicator is removed when the Team Scoreboard refreshes

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress after the 6th inning
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a No-Hitter
and the user is on the Team Page of one of the teams participating in the No-Hitter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a No-Hitter indicator above the game cell to the right of the inning

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in a suspended state
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a No-Hitter
and the user is on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a No-Hitter indicator above the game cell to the right of the inning

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is final
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a No-Hitter
and the user is on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a No-Hitter indicator above the game cell to the right of "Final"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects another game from the Date Bar that does not qualify as a No-Hitter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the No-Hitter indicator is removed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to another Team Page that does not have an active No-Hitter from a Team Page that is currently displaying the indicator
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the No-Hitter indicator is removed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Perfect Game or No-hitter indicator
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then nothing will happen and the indicator is for informational/visual purposes only

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the device is set to Spanish
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a Perfect Game (or No-Hitter)
and the indicator is on the Team Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the text in the indicator text will display in Spanish

No-Hitter - Sin hit
Perfect Game - Juego perfecto

title: Calendar
custom_preconds: User is on a Team Page view in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on the Schedule block on the Date Bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Team Schedule view is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the colors of the calendar days
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the colors for home games are correctly using the selected team's primary color
and the colors for away games are white
and there will be a key at the bottom of the view indicating the colors

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify key at the bottom of the view indicating the Home/Away colors
custom_steps_separated.expected: This will stick to the bottom and will always be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to swipe right on the Calendar and attempts to swipe left on the Calendar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to navigate to different months within the schedule

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user swipes from left or right on the calendar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Calendar correctly honors the season boundaries that have been set (firstAllowedDay and lastAllowedDay)

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the calendar cells
custom_steps_separated.expected: Games not in a final state will NOT contain 'W' or 'L' in the cells

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a calendar date cell with no game scheduled
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then nothing happens. Repeat this step for both earlier and later calendar months.

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a game that has not been started
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a preview Screen for that particular game

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is placed into a postponement state
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the calendar cell for that game is reflected correctly

Repeat this step for Postponed, Canceled, Forfeit and Suspended game types

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a split squad day calendar cell
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a pop up will be displayed showing the two games on that date

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a split squad day calendar cell of games that have not been played yet
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a pop up will be displayed showing the starting time for each game

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a split squad day calendar cell of games that are finalized
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a pop up will be displayed showing both games in a finalized state

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a game from the split squad pop up
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the appropriate game

custom_steps_separated.content: When user cancels the pop up for a split squad game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the action sheet will be dismissed and the user can continue interacting with the team schedule calendar

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a Gameday link for a game that is in progress or final as a full At Bat user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then Gameday will open to the selected game

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap the back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then you will be returned to the appropriate Team Page

custom_steps_separated.content: When you select List from the dropdown
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team schedule is displayed in a listed format

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the team schedule list date font
custom_steps_separated.expected: Date font remains consistent throughout the list

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the team schedule list game information
custom_steps_separated.expected: Team games are displayed with the day of the week, the date, the opponent

custom_steps_separated.content: Review opponent logos
custom_steps_separated.expected: Opponent logos are displayed correctly in the list

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the pitchers shown next to games in the list view for finalized games
custom_steps_separated.expected: Pitcher names are shown with W/L (Winner/Loser) next to the correct players

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the pitchers shown next to games that have not been started
custom_steps_separated.expected: Probable pitcher names are displayed if available or TBD

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the scores in the list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game scores are shown for completed games along with a W or L for the results of the selected team

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the game times in the list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the time of game is shown for each incomplete game in the list

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on the ticket icon next to a game in the list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to ticket purchasing for the selected game

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a game that has not started
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is shown the Preview window for that game

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a game that is in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to Gameday for that particular game

custom_steps_separated.content: When a split squad game is on the team's schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they will appear in the List individually as their own cells

custom_steps_separated.content: When a double header is on the team's schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they will appear in the List individually as their own cells

custom_steps_separated.content: When you switch between Calendar and List on the segment controller
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the view changes without any issues. The month being viewed in each segment is retained when switching back and forth (i.e. the view is not being reset to today's date)

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap the back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then you will be returned to the appropriate Team Page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navs to the Team Schedule List View
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a Filter icon at the bottom left corner of the view

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Filter icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will have the ability to filter through the team's schedule

custom_steps_separated.content: Available Filter Options
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Start Times
Location
Day-of-Week
Opponents

custom_steps_separated.content: Start Times
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Day
Night (any game with a start time greater than or equal to 5PM)
Both (Default)

custom_steps_separated.content: Location
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Home
Away
Both (Default)

custom_steps_separated.content: Day-of-Week
custom_steps_separated.expected:
S, M, T, W, T, F, S
(none selected as default)

custom_steps_separated.content:
Day-of-Week
(Spanish)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Days of the week in Spanish start on Monday, not Sunday. 
The days are:
L, M, M, J, V, S, D

*Make sure that the cells are shifted as well, and that the labels aren't just changed

custom_steps_separated.content: Opponents
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Broken up by division
User will be able to check off as many teams as they want
(none selected as default)

**Note:** 
The team's division should be shown first followed by the remaining divisions in the league in geographic order East to West and then the other league in E->W geographic order
Ex: 
For the SF Giants the leagues would be:
NL West
NL East
NL Central
AL East
AL Central
AL West

custom_steps_separated.content:
Tapping Clear All
(make sure this is only tappable if user has selected any other choices besides the defaults)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Filter options will be reset to the default

custom_steps_separated.content: Tapping X
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to a team schedule view filtered by the options they selected
with a grey tab at the top of the schedule listing all the filters chosen

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the X on the grey tab that lists all the chosen filters
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the the filters will be removed 
and the user will see the entire team schedule again

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls all the way to the bottom of the schedule List view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be empty rows at bottom of the list so the filter FAB does not cover a green ticket link

title: Schedule Toolbar - NOT YET
custom_preconds: Given the user is viewing the team schedule

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is viewing either the Schedule Calendar or List view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see three options in the top right corner:
Download
Today
Book a Trip

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Download button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team schedule will be downloaded to the user's device

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Today button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to today's date in the schedule

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Book a Trip button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to a webview where they will be able to book a trip to go to a game

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Book a Trip option is not available
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Download and Today icons will align left

title: Top Stories
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and user is on a Team Page

custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then there should be swipeable dynamic news feed
and the data should come from the "news" node in the team mashup

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the article data should update and the dot counter should reflect each swipe as well

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a placeholder image should appear

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a thumbnail, the blurb, duration (MM:SS) and date of the clip will be present

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is able to successfully swipe over to the beginning/end of the video list (5 videos)

custom_steps_separated.expected:

title: Tickets Module
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and the user is on a team page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls down on a team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see a tickets module

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the Tickets module
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the next 3 home games will be displayed
And the name/logo of the opponent will be displayed
And the date and time of the games will be displayed
And a "Find Seats" button will be present next each game

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on green "Find Seats" button located in each game cell
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then user is directed to the corresponding games ticket menu purchase page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the Ticket module
And there is a game with no tickets available
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the 'Find Seats' button will be removed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the Ticket module
And there are fewer than 3 Home games left on the schedule for that team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the games that are available will be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the Ticket module
And there are no games available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the view will be collapsed
And only the header with the 'More' button will be displayed

title: 'More' Button
custom_preconds:

and the user is on a team page
custom_steps: When a user taps the "More" button above the Tickets module
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to that Team's Tickets webview

title: Team Transactions
custom_preconds:
User has At Bat open and navigates to the Team Page


http://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/transactions/#month=6&year=2015

custom_steps_separated.content: When user scrolls down to the [Team] Info section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then user should see a link for "Transactions"

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on Transactions link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a list of Transactions (roster moves like signings, promotions/demotions) for that selected team only is displayed. The background tint for the header should also match selected team colors

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls through the listed transactions
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see that all of the transactions have been arranged in chronological order

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps the arrows next to the month and year
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Transactions list will change based on your selection

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a player name
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the corresponding player card is displayed for that player

custom_steps_separated.content: When user scrolls down to the [Team] Info section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then user should see a link for "Coaches"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Coaches cell
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be taken to the Coaches webview

custom_steps: When the user navs to the Team Info section of any team during the Regular Season and Postseason
custom_expected:
Then the Club Info section items will be listed in the following order:

title: Team Standings
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and user is on a team page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Standings button in the [Team] Info section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the native Standings view

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the team Standings view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the team whose page they are on will be highlighted
and the team's division will be listed first

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the team Standings view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Standings will include Team display code, W, L, %, GB, L10 and STRK
And at the bottom will include "Standings current as of MM/DD/YY HH:MM PM EST"
And will include the clinch indicator key

and the user is on a team page

custom_expected: Then the available tabs should correspond with those of the app's main standings view

title: Team Stats
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and the user is on a team page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs to the Team Info section
and taps on the "Stats" button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the native Stats view filtered by that Team

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is viewing the Batting Stats Module
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then AVG, HR, RBI, SB, R, OBP, SLG, OPS, H, 2B, 3B, and BB stats will be present

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user swipes right on the Stats module
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Pitching Leaders will appear

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is viewing the Pitching Stats module
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then ERA, W, SO, SV, WHIP, BAA, IP, and CG stats will be present

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is viewing the Batting or Pitching Stats module
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the player who is leading that team in each stat will be displayed

title: Active & 40-Man
custom_preconds:
User is on the Team Page view of At Bat

http://pubservicesv2.bamnetworks.com/lookup/json/named.roster_all.bam?team_id=113&roster_all.col_in=position_txt,name_display_first_last,jersey_number,player_id,status_code,forty_man_sw,bats,throws,height_feet,height_inches,weight,birth_date,status_short
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mobile/At+Bat+Roster+Improvements

40-Man = All players
Active = players with status_code : ‘A’ , ‘SUS’ , ‘BRV’ , ‘PL’ , 'DEC'

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Roster button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then view displays the corresponding teams roster

REPEAT for each Team

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user reviews the top header of the Roster page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a:
-Back button (Returning you to Team Page)
-Tabs to choose: Active | 40-Man | Depth Chart
-Sort button (Active & 40-Man tabs only)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user reviews the player data columns on the Active and 40-Man tabs
on HANDSET
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following columns:
- # (player number)
- [Photo]
- Name
- B/T (bats/throws)
- Age

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user reviews the player data columns on the Active and 40-Man tabs
on 7-inch tablets that support the team page view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following columns:
- # (player number)
- [Photo]
- Name
- B/T (bats/throws)
- Ht (height)
- Wt (weight)
- DOB (date of birth)
- Age

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the Sort button on the top right
(Active & 40-Man tabs only)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the picker will appear from the bottom with:

-Alphabetical button 
-Position button
-Number button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on Active and taps on the Sort button and taps on Alphabetical
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the active roster will be listed in Alphabetical order

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on Active and taps on the Sort button and taps on Position
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the active roster will be listed and grouped by Position in the following order:

1) Pitchers
2) Catchers
3) Infielders
4) Outfielders
5) Designated Hitters (if applicable)

And within each position, the players should be listed in ascending alphabetical order.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on Active and taps on the Sort button and taps on Number
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the active roster will be listed in ascending numerical order of the players' jersey numbers

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on 40-Man and taps on the Sort button and taps on Alphabetical
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the 40-Man roster will be listed in Alphabetical order

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on 40-Man and taps on the Sort button and taps on Position
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the 40-Man roster will be listed and grouped by Position in the following order:

1) Pitchers
2) Catchers
3) Infielders
4) Outfielders
5) Designated Hitters (if applicable)

And within each position, the players should be listed in ascending alphabetical order.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on Active or 40-Man and the roster is grouped by Position
and the user scrolls to the "Infielders" & "Outfielders" categories
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the infielders and outfielders will be sorted by position in the following order:
1B, 2B, 3B, SS  //  LF, CF, RF
and NOT alphabetically

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on Active or 40-Man and the roster is grouped by Position
and the user scrolls down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Position header line will be a sticky header
and will remain on at the top of the screen until all the player names from that position have been scrolled through

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on 40-Man and taps on the Sort button and taps on Number
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the 40-Man roster will be listed in ascending numerical order of the players' jersey numbers

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on Active or 40-Man and the roster is grouped by Number
and there are players without assigned numbers
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then those players will be listed in alphabetical order at the bottom of the list

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on Active or 40-Man and taps on the Sort button and taps outside of the sort picker
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the picker is dismissed and the previous results are displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps a players name
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then verify that players cards opens
And information is displayed correctly
And information fits properly on screen

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify that players who are not on the active roster, are still appearing on the 40-Man roster
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then these players will be marked with an asterisk *

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls all the way to the bottom of the Roster page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a key explaining the following:
*   Not on Active Roster
** Not on 40-Man Roster

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify that players on the DL and players who have been Designated for Assignment are still listed on the 40-Man roster
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then these players will be marked with both the asterisk and the status code

10-day DL
60-day DL
Des. for Assignment

custom_steps_separated.content:
Verify that all other status codes are hidden
(ex. NRI, Restricted, Suspended)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then these players will only be marked with a double asterisk

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls all the way to the bottom of the Roster page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see an MLB.com watermark

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user enters the team page Roster for the first time
(kill or force close app and then enter)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the default view should be Position

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user re-opens a Roster page during the same app visit 
(do NOT kill or force close app)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Roster should show the last-viewed filter type

title: Depth Chart
custom_preconds:
Depth Chart = All players sorted by: position_code, status_code, depth #

http://mlb.mlb.com/lookup/json/named.team_depth_chart.bam?team_id=110
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mobile/Depth+Chart+Android

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on Depth Chart
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then all the different depth chart positions will be listed:
Pitcher - Bullpen
Pitcher - Rotation
Catcher
First Base
Second Base
Third Base
Short Stop
Left Field
Center Field
Right Field
Designated Hitter (AL teams only)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on Depth Chart
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they will NOT see the Sort button in the top right corner

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on Depth Chart
and taps on a position
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the position list will expand
and players will be listed in the order of the team's depth chart
(tapping on the position again will collapse the list)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a player's name
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then verify that the players cards open
And information is displayed correctly
And information fits properly on screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on Depth Chart
and scrolls to the bottom
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then there will be an "Unavailable" section with players on the DL
and a "Notes" section under that with the latest DL/rehab notes for each player
and the following disclaimer: "Projected by MLB.com and not subject to the approval of the [Full Team Name]"

title: More From
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and the user is on a team page
custom_steps: When the user scrolls to the "More from the [Team Name]" section
custom_expected:
Then any information (Social Media, Auctions, app store links, etc.) the team chooses to include will be revealed
And tapping on any link will open the appropriate page

title: Team Settings
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and the user is on a team page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Settings cell in the bottom section of the team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Notification screen
And the user should be scrolled to the team whose page they came in from
And the notifications for that team should be expanded by default

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user enables/disables Push notifications for that team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be properly subscribed/unsubscribed to the team's channel
And the user will/won't receive Push Notifications based on the action they took

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navs to a team page on an Amazon device
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Settings cell will not appear on the team page

title: Native Team Transactions - NOT YET
custom_preconds: http://mlb.mlb.com/lookup/named.transaction_all.bam?&team_id=147&start_date=20130405

custom_steps_separated.content: When user scrolls down below the News, Videos, Ballpark section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then user should see a button/link under the Roster link for "Transactions"

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on Transactions link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a list of Transactions (roster moves like signings, promotions/demotions) for that selected team only is displayed. The background tint for the header should also match selected team colors.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls through the listed transactions
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see that all of the transactions have been arranged in chronological order. Transactions that happened closest to the present date will appear higher in the list.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks through the history of team transactions for the supported date range
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should only see transactions that go back as far as 2 years ago

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user checks the header area, to the right of "Transactions"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see a calendar icon in the top right of the screen

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps the calendar icon and selects a new date range from the calendar picker
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Transactions list is scrolled to the selected Month, Day and Year. Repeat for a wide variety of date selections including today's date and up to 2 years prior. Repeat for different teams.

custom_steps_separated.content: When a player's name is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it will be highlighted with the team's tint

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a player name
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the corresponding player card is displayed for that player. Player card is functioning properly for all players included in the transaction (stat tabs are working, stats can be scrolled, card can be dismissed)

custom_steps_separated.content: When user searches for a date over a year ago and then scrolls up
custom_steps_separated.expected: A Load More button appears

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps Load More button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then more transaction records are displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When user selects a new date range from the calendar picker where the selected team has not completed any transactions
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the text "No Transactions" will appear in the space provided and below the date and transaction closest to the selected date will be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When user is on a team homepage where the team has a black tint color
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the player links in the transactions will appear in the team's tertiary color

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is observing the Day of the Week, Date, and Transaction on the Transaction page in different time zones

ET, CT, MT, MST, PT (also test with 24 Hour)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the transaction is on the correct day of the week and date regardless of time zone
